coded_answer.p: ToFor the attention of the Circle Theatre Manager:
I am writing to complain about your show "Over the rainbow" and the conditions in which it is heldperformed.

I was having a week's holiday in London when I decided to go to the theatre and see a musical show. I had read your advertisement in a morning newspaper and the show seemed very attractive to me. Moreover an English friend of mine had told me that it would purelyreally be a good show as Danny Brook was a very good actor.

So on Saturday, June 7, I was there for the 7:30 pm show and here are my reasons for complaining. Firstly, there were no discounts available such as those stated in your advertisement, not even for students, and I had to pay for a full-price ticket. Secondly, we had to wait until 8:00 pm before being able to havetake a seat and the show finally beginnedbegan at 8:15!

No need to say how much I was disappointed to see that another actor was performing instead of Danny Brook and the actor didn't seem to have rehearsed the role very much. At the end of the show, I decided to have dinner in your theatre restaurant and I went there ...justonly to find out that it was closed because it was being newly paintedrepainted.

To sum up, it was not the "perfect evening out!" you advertised. So I am asking you to pay me back at least half of the ticket price for the inconvenience that was caused to me. I hope that you will understand my request and reply to me in a positive way by sending me a cheque to my address in France (see the letterhead).
Looking forward to receiving your reply very soon.
